image.altText: People walking on a footpath with arches of a 19th century stone building

props.synopsis: The result of an Adelaide City Council ward election in 2022 was affected by "illegal practices" involving people handling ballot papers that were not issued to them, a court has found, in a ruling which could trigger supplementary elections.

title.children: 'Illegal practices' affected Adelaide City Council election result, judge finds

image.altText: Steve Gillis looks ahead wearing a black polo shirt as he stands on a golf course

props.synopsis: Steve Gillis spent months trying to find answers to the "constant companions" of tinnitus, brain fog and visual disturbances that followed him after he had recovered from a virus. Now there are hopes others with visual snow syndrome will face an easier path to diagnosis.

title.children: 'Huge relief' for visual snow syndrome patients after WHO inclusion

image.altText: Dancers at Womad

props.synopsis: Womadelaide's director says Adelaide, like Edinburgh in Scotland, is a successful city for major festivals because residents embrace arts with loyal support.

title.children: Womadelaide proof that major festivals thrive in smaller cities

image.altText: A woman in green shirt stands behind a sign that reads 'Tarella Station'.

props.synopsis: Australians are using wearable technology more than ever to keep fit, and for those living in remote and regional areas it has brought the gym to their doorstep.

title.children: Jo's outback gym is the road into town and the coach is on her wrist

image.altText: Queen Omega looks at camera with colourful braids in her hair

props.synopsis: After 25 years in the game, Queen Omega is enjoying her biggest success yet.

title.children: After hundreds of millions of views, Queen Omega finally visits Australia

image.altText: A dancer in Pina Bausch work Café Müller. In a nightdress, she wraps her arms around her body, eyes emotively closed

props.synopsis: A dance masterpiece never seen in Australian before — except on grainy video recordings — is about to be performed. It's been described as a life-changing work of art.

title.children: Eyes closed, stumbling, naked: These dancers are like nothing you've seen

image.altText: Three abalone shells sitting on a hessian sack.

props.synopsis: The SA government closes one of the state's three abalone fisheries as abalone viral ganglioneuritis continues to spread.

title.children: Deadly virus brings $4 million abalone industry to a standstill

image.altText: A mother plays with her kid, drawing at a table.

props.synopsis: Domestic violence and child protection workers could leave if South Australia pushes ahead with proposed guidelines for a national-first social worker registration scheme, advocates are warning.

title.children: Concerns 'children could die' under proposed details for social worker registration scheme

image.altText: A woman with long brown hair, wearing a pink top and navy jacket, standing across the street from a historic hotel.

props.synopsis: Media personality Ali Clarke has shared how she was verbally abused and refused a ride by a taxi driver in Adelaide.

title.children: Radio presenter refused taxi ride, abused by driver in Adelaide

image.altText: A dried up dam with cracked soil and little water

props.synopsis: Children are skipping school because families are running out of water to shower or wash uniforms, a South Australian mayor says amid record dry weather in the state.

title.children: 'Dirty uniforms': Families in Adelaide's south face water shortages

image.altText: Lady with long brown hair, black dress and yellow rainbow earrings stares somber at the camera with a child memorial behind

props.synopsis: When Bronwyn Helgeson's five-year-old son died suddenly, she was left dealing with unimaginable grief and unexpected financial costs.

title.children: Australia 'behind the game' with helping families navigate child loss

image.altText: A man standing in front of a water truck.

props.synopsis: South Australia's farmers are worried about water supplies for livestock as drought conditions cause dams to dry up across the state.

title.children: Dry dams leave SA farmers deciding to buy water or sell livestock

image.altText: An office building facing a suburban road.

props.synopsis: An investigation is underway into the handling of grant funding by past management at one of South Australia's largest disability advocacy services.

title.children: Disability advocacy service under investigation, clients told to 'represent yourself'

image.altText: Boat damage onlookers

props.synopsis: With ex-Tropical Cyclone Alfred now downgraded to a tropical low, Bribie Island locals say they're relieved the island went relatively unscathed.

title.children: Bribie locals assess damage as ex-Tropical Cyclone Alfred lingers

image.altText: A police car outside a crime scene.

props.synopsis: Canadian police say at least 12 people have been injured in a shooting at a Toronto pub and the gunman remains at large.

title.children: Twelve injured and gunman at large after Toronto pub shooting

image.altText: a flooded park in lismore after heavy rains hit in the lead up to cyclone alfred

props.synopsis: Hundreds of thousands of residents in northern NSW are anxiously waiting for the full impact of ex-Tropical Cyclone Alfred, as rescue teams continue their search for a man washed away in floodwaters.

title.children: NSW premier warns against complacency with fears south Lismore levee could break

image.altText: Multiple webcam screens show screenshots of different locations of Cyclone Alfred

props.synopsis: As Cyclone Alfred impacts the coastline watch the wild weather as it hits from the Sunshine Coast down to northern NSW.

title.children: Watch live: Cyclone Alfred webcam videos show wild weather

image.altText: gene hackman and his wife betsy arakawa

props.synopsis: Betsy Arakawa, wife of actor Gene Hackman, died of a hantavirus infection a full week before her husband. Medical experts have said it has a low mortality rate and was mostly spread by rodents.

title.children: What is the rodent-transmitted illness that killed Gene Hackman's wife?

image.altText: Albanese stands at a lectern, a digital weather map behind him.

props.synopsis: Natural disasters require politicians — along with everyone else — to try to lift themselves out of the political twirl and into more conspicuous leadership roles.

title.children: Trump's long shadow reaches almost every aspect of Australian politics now

image.altText: Four people standing at electronic voting booths.

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese had planned to call the election on Sunday for an April 12 poll, but is delaying the announcement due to Cyclone Alfred's expected landfall on Saturday.

title.children: Albanese rules out April election, with federal budget set for March 25

image.altText: Roger Cook, Libby Mettam and Shane Love.

props.synopsis: Experts aren't predicting another WA election wipe-out today, but there is a clear winner. Here's everything you need to know ahead of today's poll.

title.children: When will we know the results of the West Australian election? Here's what you need to know

image.altText: Vladimir Putin stares at Donald Trump with pursed lips.

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump, who is considering imposing fresh sanctions on Moscow, has described Russia as easier to deal with than Ukraine.

title.children: Russia launches massive drone attack as Trump calls Putin 'easier'

image.altText: A young woman in tennis whites reacts emotionally on a grass court in front of cheering fans.

props.synopsis: From the tennis court to the runway, this is how Ash Barty and other trailblazers overcame some of their toughest challenges.

title.children: Ash Barty on tennis, Blak Barbie and learning from her 'darkest times'

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: A close-up portrait of an elderly woman

props.synopsis: Aboriginal rights trailblazer Margaret Tucker is among a group of remarkable women who will be represented in creative projects in a bid to improve gender representation in Victoria's public art.

title.children: Victorian trailblazers to be immortalised with public artworks

image.altText: Two firemen stand among burning wood as they put out a fire that is burning nearby

props.synopsis: Russia has repeatedly targeted key energy assets inside Ukraine, with officials accusing the Kremlin of 'weaponising winter'.

title.children: Russia 'weaponising winter' in aerial attacks that injured 10

props.synopsis: The Arab Peace Initiative has been floated for the past two decades and it offers to resolve conflict in accordance with international law, guarantee Israel's security and normalise relations with all its Arab neighbours, but neither Donald Trump or Benjamin Netanyahu back it.

title.children: This plan would end the Israel-Palestine conflict, but Israel doesn't like it

image.altText: Donald Trump grinning next to a US flag while wearing a dark suit and maroon checked tie

props.synopsis: The US president wants to sell residency visas with a path to citizenship to wealthy foreigners — including Russian oligarchs — but experts say they risk importing crime to America.

title.children: Trump has been deporting migrants. Now he wants to sell $5m Gold Card visas

image.altText: A supermarket vacuum package of Huon Aquaculture roasted salmon

props.synopsis: A video released earlier this week of live and dead salmon being sealed into tubs has led to a leading animal welfare suspending its certification.

title.children: RSPCA suspends Huon Aquaculture certification over live fish disposal

image.altText: Benjamin Klein inside the Adass Israel Synagogue, standing in a room surrounded with fire-damaged walls.

props.synopsis: In the months after the December attack that devastated Melbourne's Jewish community, the synagogue's congregation has rallied, finding a makeshift place to pray and fundraising for the eventual rebuild of the site.

title.children: Melbourne synagogue congregation plans rebuild while waiting for justice

image.altText: Large crowd gathered with beach in background

props.synopsis: Memories of Black Summer are everywhere here. But I know as another diaster looms resilience is possible — it's something we will fight for. Even when the fights get so much harder.

title.children: 'I wondered if I'd ever come back': Returning to a place ravaged by fire

image.altText: ghost net brett peake

props.synopsis: The unusual discovery of a ghost net — a lost or dumped fishing net drifting through the ocean — washed up near Albany sparks concern for the nets' impact on local marine life.

title.children: Ghost net found on WA's south coast sparks fears for sea life

image.altText: A woman stands on the sand holding a surfboard and looks towards the water.

props.synopsis: Two-time surfing World Champion Tyler Wright has described her sport as one that can be dangerous for women, and research shows she's not the only one who's been intimidated in the water.

title.children: 'I've had someone hit me in the head': Tyler Wright on surfing's 'dangerous' culture

image.altText: man in light blue shirt with goatee

props.synopsis: A murder trial has heard a Cairns man reported a "suspicious" sighting on the beach where the 24-year-old woman was found buried in 2018.

title.children: Court hears man's wife warned he could become suspect of Toyah Cordingley's murder

image.altText: Road sign towards Avalon airport and precinct with car driving past.

props.synopsis: Police say a teenager allegedly entered Avalon Airport through a hole in the security fence before he boarded a Jetstar flight armed with a loaded shotgun.

title.children: Security at regional airports under microscope after major security breach
